children.subject: Another rising senior here, I completely agree with you. It's abysmal how the department treats its upper division students with respect to this current policy where it's geared to prioritizing non seniors. There should be at least an opportunity for seniors to have some number of seats set aside. Freshman, Sophomores and Juniors have plenty of time to defer 16B and still being able to take the class and eventually declare if that's still to be done with the major. Seniors who are risking not graduating on time due to this uneven reservation policy are seriously undermined in their ability and the department henceforth should strictly re-evaluate its policy concerning EE16B

Another LSCS senior here (not EECS), even though I have interned for FAANG last summer, and this summer, I still don't understand why we still need EE16B to graduate. I self-learning 16B over summer (already watched first half of Spring 2020 lectures) and I don't see any useful knowledge I can use in the Software Engineering career. Again, I'm LSCS, not EE-CS. Maybe the department needs to find a solution sth like change 16B requirement or grade option to PNP, which really help senior students.

history.content: Hello! I just wanted to know why this is the case. I am an incoming senior who needs 1 more class to graduate. That class is EE16B. I first phased this class, yet I'm still on the wailist and it seems like the chance of getting off of it is low. I think there needs to be a change in the "reserved seating" to include computer science majors because this is extremely dumb.
history.subject: Senior EE16B First Phase
